name: Spectromancer
description: Open your mind and discover your power as you explore the world of Spectromancer! A turn-based online fantasy card game, co-designed by Magic: The Gathering's Richard Garfield and Alexey Stankevich, creator of Astral Tournament and Astral Masters, Spectromancer allows players to participate in a magical duel against other mages by...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 2000/XP/Vista                     Processor: P3 class or faster                     Memory: 128 MB                     Graphics: GeForce-2 class or faster with 32+ MB RAM, 1024x768 screen resolution                     DirectX Version: DirectX 8                     Hard Drive: 50 MB

reviews.review_text: Great game but beware, draconic DRM you can only install the game 5 times then your key becomes blocked. Wouldn't have bought this if I new that, and no more buying DLC for me. Not a recommended game to buy until DRM is removed.

Addicting card game that eliminates the maddening tendencies of most TCGs. Everyone gets the same deck, more or less, so money won't buy you special cards. There's an active multiplayer community and is a great game solo as well. Incredibly simple, but really works.
A good variation on two player MTG the new DLCs add a lot of options and it is more of a tactical game than MTG, as it is not about what cards you draw but how you use your manna.

Fast paced Magic the Gahtering alike game. Mechanics are comparable but cleary have been optimized for internet gameplay. Games take around 10 minutes per round (although some can take up to 40 minutes), which is a lot faster then MTG: Planeswalker. Don't get me wrong, i like both games, and i have both on steam, but spectromancer will win in the long run! :)
Its a lot of fun and wrote especially now with dlc you have deck buiilding
If you like card games this is for you, extreamly simple and the so elegant at the same time, and there is full cross-play betwean the ''vanilla'' version and the expantions. well worth your time!

Fun, but underwhelming. The cards don't gather quite enough synergy to be truly exciting, and the one campaign makes for repetitive gameplay. Still, for the short while it lasts, it is fun, and it's fun for a game or two with a friend.  It's worth $10, although, at the price they are, I can't recommend the DLC.
Spectromancer is absolutly fun. It's got a unique take on the way you play.  It's a little old now due to current titles coming out, but none the less, it's very fun to play.
Such a fun game to play with friends. Richard Garfield's still got it.
Very simplistic version of card games like magic the gathering. Its not bad, just short. I ended up getting this in a indie pack for a dollar. Well worth the dollar.
